item.title: Brainrot Tsunami Codes (October 2025)
item.content:encoded:
Use these Brainrot Tsunami monthly redeem codes for October 2025 to get free rewards in the game, including in-game currencies as well as potions. 

Brainrot Tsunami is often described as a weird Roblox simulator game where players must navigate tsunami waves and run through the map. Starting with a low speed, players are tasked with training to improve their pace, thereby making the process of dodging the tsunami waves that much easier. Another key mechanic in the game requires players to train with Brainrots. The game also allows players to spawn special tsunami waves, which can be used to troll the competition. As simple as the gameplay sounds, there is a decent amount of strategy involved, and with that in mind, any way to get ahead of the other players must be considered. Thatâ€™s exactly where these codes will come into the picture. 

Active Brainrot Tsunami Codes

  • Release â€“ Free rewards

Expired Brainrot Tsunami Codes

As of the writing of this article, there are no expired codes in Brainrot Tsunami. However, as soon as one of the active codes expires, we will immediately update this page to indicate that. Players are hence urged to redeem the active codes as soon as possible, as there is no fixed timeline for their validity. 

How To Redeem Brainrot Tsunami Codes 

Unlike many Roblox games today, redeeming codes in Brainrot Tsunami is a fairly straightforward process. The developers havenâ€™t imposed any prerequisite steps on the players, in that all they have to redeem the codes is navigate through the menus and input one of the active codes given above into the correct text box. For players who may be new to the Roblox ecosystem though, hereâ€™s a detailed step-by-step guide on how to redeem codes in this game: 

  1. Launch Roblox and open up Brainrot Tsunami.
  2. Click on the shop button on the left side of the screen.
  3. Click on the â€˜Codesâ€™ tab.
  4. Input one of the active codes given above into the text box that pops up.
  5. Click the â€˜Verifyâ€™ button to claim your rewards.

How To Get More Brainrot Tsunami Codes

Brainrot Tsunami recently had an update, but unfortunately for players, they didnâ€™t release any new codes. However, fans of the game mustnâ€™t lose hope, as the developers are still working on the game, which means that new codes are likely on the horizon. New codes are often released through the gameâ€™s official Discord server or through the Roblox game page. However, to make staying up to date with the codes easier, we recommend that you keep this page bookmarked. We update this article as soon as any new codes drop, so check in every once in a while to maximise the number of rewards you can get.

Having fun using codes in Roblox games? Then check out the latest codes for 99 Nights in the Forest, Type Soul, and Azure Latch. Also, check out the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Former Ensemble Studios Dev Blames Xbox Head Don Mattrick For â€˜Killingâ€™ Halo MMO
item.content:encoded:
Once upon a time, Halo was set to secure an MMO dubbed â€˜Titanâ€™, pieced together by Ensemble Studios, a company shut down in January 2009. In a scalding post on social media, Sandy Petersen, who had been with Ensemble since the 1990s, revealed that Don Mattrick, former overseer of the Xbox brand, killed the project to protect his corporate bonus.

This pulling back of the curtain is a fiery look back at the scrapping of a game that, on paper, sounded very interesting.

Titan Was a Prequel MMO in the Halo Universe

In a post on social media, Sandy Petersen, who was once a level designer working on Doom and Quake before joining Ensemble Studios, revealed why Haloâ€™s â€˜Titanâ€™ MMO never saw the light of day:

In 2008, Ensemble Studios started planning a gigantic MMO set in the Halo universe. We code-named it Titan. It was to take place tens of thousands of years ago, before the Halos were set off & destroyed all sentient life in the Galaxy.

It was all brought to naught when Don Mattrick realized that his stock bonus was based on the income MS had from games in 3 years.

You see, we estimated 3.5 years to finish Titan if we did it right. And thatâ€™s beyond Mattrickâ€™s drop dead date.

So by firing ALL of Ensemble, he didnâ€™t have to pay for our expensive studio for 3 years and he didnâ€™t care about Titan.

Petersen revealed that the would-be Halo MMO would have featured an expansive universe that allowed players to assume control of Forerunners or Covenant characters. The Flood also had a starring spot in the game, but wouldnâ€™t have been playable, of course.

The quest lines were mapped out, the homeworlds were designed, and Microsoft estimated that the game would have made a whopping $1.1 billion.

Petersen went on to further slam Mattrick, settling on it being part of the executiveâ€™s nature in the industry:P

All he lost was a game studio who never sold less than 3 million copies of everything we made. I donâ€™t believe he did justice to MicroSoft stockholders but hey â€“ Don started as an EA hatchet man so what would you expect?

Petersen and the wider Ensemble Studios team were tasked with bringing to life this ancient Halo setting, and the game was seemingly deep in development when the plug was pulled, and the hand on the cable was Don Mattrickâ€™s. It was once suggested that Titan would have taken unique concepts, such as time travel, and taken a deep dive into the lore of Halo.

Don Mattrick served as the President of Microsoftâ€™s Interactive Entertainment arm, overseeing the strategy of Xbox until he departed from the firm in 2013 to instead serve as the CEO of Zynga.

Haloâ€™s Titan isnâ€™t to be confused with Blizzardâ€™s Titan MMO, another canceled game that came to a head after an $80 million investment.

Do you wish weâ€™d seen the Halo MMO that Ensemble Studios was working on? Let me know what youâ€™re thinking about the project on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: KT Rolster Shatter Expectations to Reach Worlds 2025 Finals For the First Time
item.content:encoded:
KT Rolster has pulled something monumental out of the bag, handing Gen.G an insane loss at the League of Legends World Championship in Shanghai. This is the first time that KT Rolster has reached such lofty heights, and it came after knocking out one of the favorites to win the entire event.

The devastating loss kicks Gen.G out of the tournament in fourth place, mere weeks after winning the 2025 Mid-Season Invitational, the Esports World Cup, and the LCK 2025 season.

Gen.G Fails to Make Finals Yet Again

Gen.G has now failed to make the finals at LoL Worlds eight years in a row. In 2021, the organization secured a third-place finish, which is the closest the team has been thus far to making the number one spot.

KT Rolster proved to be the obstacle too strong to overcome for Gen.G this time around. The South Korean squad put up one hell of a fight, going the distance in a best-of-five series mere days after devastating CTBC Flying Oyster in a 3 â€“ 0 sweep.

The team now has a spot in the Grand Final, poised to fight either T1 or Top Esports. Itâ€™ll be one for the history books, especially with T1 sitting on a burner with the squadâ€™s typical Worlds buff.

In KT Rolsterâ€™s history in the League of Legends space, the organization has won almost nothing to write home about, and in the last three Worlds tournaments the brand has attended, lacklustre finishes have left fans wanting more. Even if KT Rolster doesnâ€™t win at the November 9 final, itâ€™ll be the biggest single prize the organization has ever claimed â€“ $800,000.

Do you have any high expectations for KT Rolster, and do you believe the team could beat a dominant T1? Let me know on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that GamerLegion is not selling players to 100 Thieves

item.title: GamerLegion CEO Disputes Claims of 100 Thieves Player Buyout But Confirms Return
item.content:encoded:
Recently, rumors surfaced in the Counter-Strike space that 100 Thieves is preparing for a mighty comeback to the scene, signing HÃ¥vard â€˜rainâ€™ Nygaard to lead a new roster backed by GamerLegion talent. In an even more recent post, the CEO of GamerLegion confirmed that no such sales are lined up.

However, the CEO, Nicolas Reber, confirmed that the organization met with 100 Thieves to discuss â€˜their intention to come back to CSâ€™. This effectively bolsters the recent suggestions that the LA-based company is breaking back into Counter-Strike.

GamerLegion Isnâ€™t Selling Players to 100 Thieves

In a post on social media, Nicolas Reber, CEO of GamerLegion, confirmed:

Guess its worth to share.

We had a chat with 100T few weeks ago about their intention to come back to CS, but there is no active discussion about selling any players or cores. We focus on the team we have right now.

Lets get that 3rd place at @pglesports!

The signing of rain hasnâ€™t been announced yet either, so thereâ€™s still time for that claim to be refuted.

100 Thieves was last seen in Counter-Strike more than five years ago. Itâ€™s a new world these days, but with 100 Thieves preparing to pull out of League of Legends after Worlds, thereâ€™s room for a new roster to rise. The iconic organization fields a current roster in painfully few games, and Counter-Strike is an easy one to step into.

Some have questioned 100 Thieves potentially signing GamerLegion talent, given that there are â€˜much better organizationsâ€™ to pick from and GamerLegion has had more than a year of bad luck, failing to secure a single major victory for a long while.

What do you think about the potential return of 100 Thieves to Counter-Strike? Let me know what youâ€™re thinking on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: PGL Reveals Massive Eight-Event CS2 Calendar For 2028
item.content:encoded:
PGL is yet again doubling down on an ongoing commitment to Counter-Strike 2 after unveiling a huge competitive calendar for 2028. Between 2027 and 2028, a whopping 15 Tier 1 tournaments will play out, including a full slate of eight events for 2028 alone. Itâ€™s easily one of the most ambitious schedules in Counter-Strikeâ€™s esports history.

PGLâ€™s 2027 calendar is looking similarly hefty, with six tournaments being lined up to span January through October.

PGL is Supercharging Counter-Strike 2â€™s Calendar

In a press release, the PGL team revealed that 2027 will see six independently produced tournaments and one massive collaboration: the Perfect World Counter-Strike Asia Championships.

Hereâ€™s the schedule revealed thus far for 2027:

  • February 11â€“22
  • March 17â€“29
  • April 14â€“26
  • August 17â€“29
  • September 1â€“13
  • October 6â€“18

Looking even further ahead into 2028, a staggering schedule has been lined up for Counter-Strike fans around the world. Hereâ€™s the full list of PGL tournaments planned for 2028:

  • February 9â€“21
  • March 22â€“April 3
  • April 19â€“May 1
  • August 16â€“28
  • August 31â€“September 11
  • October 4â€“16
  • November 1â€“13

This is shaping up to be unprecedented in the Counter-Strike 2 space, and it reflects the ongoing value of the game and the ecosystem surrounding it.

The most recent PGL event, PGL Masters Bucharest, wrapped up just yesterday, with Aurora securing the trophy and picking up the lionâ€™s share of the $625,000 grand prize. The win marked Auroraâ€™s most sizeable victory to date in the Counter-Strike space and came mere months after falling in second place at the Esports World Cup.

Are you looking forward to the spate of PGL events coming up in the next few years? Let me know on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: NYT Connections Hints Today (#875)â€”Clues and Answers for Sunday, November 2
item.content:encoded:
Itâ€™s a sleepy Sunday, but while youâ€™re finding time to relax, youâ€™ll also need to find an opportunity to complete todayâ€™s NYT Connections puzzle. Fortunately, Iâ€™m here to help you on your way with the latest NYT Connections hints and solutions, to give you the best chance possible of dominating todayâ€™s challenge.

Read on to get the best NYT Connections hints, and scroll to the bottom of the page if you want to jump to todayâ€™s answers.

What is NYT Connections?

It would be remiss of me not to give a little foundational backstory before leaping into todayâ€™s NYT Connections clues and hints.

In June 2023, NYT Connections emerged as yet another game in the ever-growing New York Times lineup. This title soared immediately, and itâ€™s easy to see why. As a free-to-play, accessible New York Times game, NYT Connections is available to users worldwide and can be played on either desktop devices or via a mobile app.

Playing NYT Connections on your commute or while waiting for a coffee is a fantastic way to kill a few minutes.

But how do you play NYT Connections?

Itâ€™s relatively simple, and thatâ€™s why itâ€™s the best New York Times game, in my opinion.

The NYT team will provide you with a grid of 16 words once a day. The only task left up to you is to sort those words into four groups of four by finding their commonalities. Every NYT Connections puzzle has just one solution, and some words might have a double meaning, so it can sometimes be tricky to figure out the answers.

Itâ€™s also important to stress that the words are color-coded: yellow, blue, green, and purple. Thatâ€™s in order of difficulty from least to most difficult, too.

Whatâ€™s critical here is that you get four guesses every day, and if you use those, your NYT Connections answers for today will be out of reach, as itâ€™ll be game over.

Todayâ€™s NYT Connections Hints (November 2)

If you want to figure out todayâ€™s NYT Connections clues without getting the answers outright, Iâ€™ll start with the words themselves. Perhaps just seeing the words here will spur your brain into action, and youâ€™ll spot the trends immediately.

Here are the NYT Connections words from todayâ€™s puzzle, #875:

  • GEM
  • LOAD
  • FAWN
  • SWEAT
  • CARGO
  • TAN
  • SAG
  • CRAMP
  • HAUL
  • AQUA
  • REDDEN
  • CAMEL
  • FREIGHT
  • PANT
  • KHAAKI
  • CAPRI

And here are the hints I can offer for todayâ€™s NYT Connections:

  • Yellow â€“ Think of items or terms associated with moving goods or heavy items. These are all about what gets carried or shipped.
  • Green â€“ Each word here is a color that falls within the brown or beige spectrumâ€”often used in fashion or design.
  • Blue â€“ These words describe what happens to your body when youâ€™re working hard, exercising, or overheating.
  • Purple â€“ These are all names or abbreviations of astrological signs. Some are less obvious, so think symbolically.

Hereâ€™s the final warning before we get to the NYT Connections answers for today, November 2.

Are you sure you want to scroll further?

Very well!

NYT Connections Answers for Today, November 2 (#875)

If you want to jump straight to the answers for todayâ€™s NYT Connections puzzle, Iâ€™ve got you covered:

  • Yellow â€“ CARGO, FREIGHT, HAUL, LOAD
  • Green â€“ CAMEL, FAWN, KHAKI, TAN
  • Blue â€“ CRAMP, PANT, REDDEN, SWEAT
  • Purple â€“ AQUA, CAPRI, GEM, SAG

When Does NYT Connections Reset?

Thatâ€™s todayâ€™s puzzle, but if you want the next one, the game resets daily at midnight local time (thatâ€™s your local time). Youâ€™ll have 24 hours to complete the puzzle when midnight ticks over in your timezone.

How did you do? Did you get a perfect run? Let me know what your streak looks like on the Insider Gaming Discord server
